data.description:
Perpetual is a watchface that displays the time, date, month and the weekday in an analogue fashion.

The hour hand is red, and the minute hand is white. The 6 markers are ten minute markers.

In between the 12 o'clock mark and the 2 o'clock  mark is the AM/PM indicator. The dot is white during the AM and turns black in the PM.

The Date is represented by a red circle which resides on the outer ring of 30 + 1 circles. The 10-minute markers make it easier to read the date. For example the marker on the 30th minute indicates the 15th of the month (30รท2=15).

The Month resides as a red dot in the central ring. The dot's position on the dial represents the current month. For example, if the dot is on the 6th hour, the month is June. At 2 o'clock the date would be February. At 12 o'clock, its December.

The Day of the Week resides at the lower half of the circle as black dots. The current day of the week is represented by a red dot. It starts at the second marker (20 minutes) at Sunday. At the 6th hour mark, it would be Wednesday. On the 8th hour mark it would be Saturday.

The watch will vibrate (long-long-short) when bluetooth is disconnected. Or you can disable that behaviour.

Make it yours by customizing every color or choose from one of the defined themes.
You can also use a metal texture style of the background color.

Screenshot examples:
1) Monday, March 31, 11:25 PM
2) Monday, September 1, 3:00 AM
3) Wednesday, November 20, 5:25 AM
4) Saturday, July 23, 12:00 AM

The design is inspired by Ludwig Oechslin's Perpetual Calendar.
